result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Danielson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).
  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Enter, participate in, and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the Agent; may not withdraw from any treatment program involved in unless given the express permission of the Agent and treatment provider.  Take medications as prescribed by treating physician.  Cooperate with and complete AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment. Cooperate with and complete Psychological assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Cooperate with and complete Anger Management treatment.  Cooperate with and complete a criminal thinking - cognitive program.  No alcohol/illegal substances or drug paraphernalia. Obtain/maintain education and/or employment.  Submit to a DNA sample unless previously provided.  Pay costs and supervision fees as directed by the Agent.  No firearms-Weapons; No contact with victims unless approved by agent.

timeConds.notes: w/huber on or before 5/1/15 @ 9:00 am.  Court is not opposed to being servied in Polk County.  Also, agent can OK the splitting up of the jail sentence if needed.
Court orders a min of 2 hours per month

Court rules:

Counts 1&2 - 2 years initial conf 3 years extended supervision - STAYED

4 years probation Imposed
